artefact.overview: You may need to tell DVLA If you have Hodgkin's lymphoma
artefact.body:
You may need to tell DVLA if you have Hodgkin’s lymphoma (Hodgkin’s disease).

You can be fined up to £1,000 if you don’t tell DVLA about a medical condition that affects your driving. If you’re involved in an accident, you may be prosecuted.

Car or motorcycle licence

You don’t need to tell DVLA. However, you will need to tell DVLA if: 

  • you develop any problems with the brain or nervous system 
  • your doctor has expressed concerns about your fitness to drive 
  • you can only drive vehicles with either special adaptations or certain types of vehicle
  • your medication causes side effects which could affect your driving

Bus, coach or lorry licence

You must tell DVLA. Fill in form C1V and send it to the address on the form.

Download ‘C1V - Confidential medical information’ (PDF, 260KB)
